inlineContent.text: FluidInterfaceKit

abstract.text: provides the advanced infrastructure for your iPhone apps.

inlineContent.text: Built on top of UIKit, replace UIKit standard transitions with the custom components.
It provides components that make your app more flexible - interactive and interruptible transition, free to unwind view controllers without
or
That would fit to create fully customized UI apps such as Snapchat, Zenly, Uber, Instagram Threads.
FluidInterfaceKit’s essential component is
, which stacks view controllers with customized transitions.
Apps run with this component, only stacking but it can get flexibility instead.
iOS 12 +
Swift 5.6
iPhone platform (Currently iPad not supported)
Packages
With these packages, productivity may gain.
Normally, UIKit offers us to get screen management with
In the case of a view controller that needs to display on modal and navigation, that view controller requires to supports both.In modal, what if it uses
, should be wrapped with
to display.
Moreover, that view controller would consider how to dismiss itself unless handled by outside.Pop or dismiss which depends on the context.
FluidInterfaceKit
provides
, which is similar to
. It offers all of the view controllers that are managed in stacking as a child of the stack.
Try to think of it with what if we’re using

.All view controllers will display on that, and push to the next view controller, what if needed nesting, push another UINavigationController.Expression of transition would not be a problem, we can create a custom transition, so it can be like a modal presentation - slide in from the bottom.
If the app runs like that, we only use
and
to manage screens except for the special case of using
- UIAlertController or other modals in third-party libraries. Still, modals work very well since nobody use presentation.
As above mentioned,
is similar to
, it just stacks view controllers that are managed as a child.What difference with
is
transitions
, it provides interfaces to create custom transition and it supports more flexibility.
Custom transitions that run with
have some limitations in modal-presentation and push-transition.It supports cancellation, which would be a part of flexibility, but it’s not enough.

Please see what happens in iOS Home Screen, it supports completely responding to user interaction - opening an app, canceling opening by Home bar, moving back the home, then opening the app again by touch.
FluidInterfaceKit provides flexibility in UIKit’s transitioning operation.
Instead of using modal-presentation, take advantage of
Which stacks view controllers in Z-axis, representing like modal presentation.
A container view controller actually manages a view of view controller with
and
. That we have to manage the life cycle of theirs, interruptions completely. But we use this for getting flexibility.
